text: What is the difference between let and var in JavaScript?

let is function-scoped, var is block-scoped

text: What does the optional chaining operator (?.) do?

options.text: Returns undefined if the left side is null or undefined, otherwise continues
Throws an error if a property doesn't exist
Creates a new property if it doesn't exist
Returns null for any undefined value

text: What is a closure in JavaScript?

options.text: A function that has access to variables in its outer (enclosing) lexical scope
A way to close a function
A method to prevent memory leaks
A type of loop

text: What does the spread operator (...) do when used with arrays?

Combines multiple arrays into one
Removes duplicate elements
Sorts the array

It makes code run faster
It prevents errors

text: What happens when you use Object.assign()?

text: What is the difference between == and === in JavaScript?

== checks both value and type, === only checks value
There is no difference
=== is deprecated, use == instead

text: What does the 'class' keyword in JavaScript create?

options.text: A constructor function with prototype-based inheritance
A completely new type system
A namespace
A module

text: What is the event loop in JavaScript?

options.text: A mechanism that handles asynchronous operations by managing the call stack and callback queue
A type of loop like for or while
A way to prevent infinite loops
A debugging tool
The behavior where variable and function declarations are moved to the top of their scope before code execution
A way to lift elements in the DOM
A method to prevent variable redeclaration
A feature that only works with arrow functions

text: What are template literals in JavaScript?

options.text: String literals that allow embedded expressions and multi-line strings using backticks
A way to create HTML templates that can be rendered in the browser using special syntax
A method to format numbers with specific decimal places and currency symbols
A type of array literal that stores template objects

text: What does destructuring assignment allow you to do in JavaScript?

options.text: Extract values from arrays or properties from objects into distinct variables
Remove elements from arrays or delete properties from objects permanently
Convert arrays to objects and objects to arrays automatically
Create deep copies of complex nested data structures without any side effects

text: What is the main purpose of the reduce() method in JavaScript?

options.text: To reduce an array to a single value by applying a function to each element
To reduce memory usage by compressing array elements into a more compact format
To reduce the number of iterations needed by optimizing the array traversal algorithm
To reduce callback execution time by batching multiple operations into a single pass
